text: hi guys I'm Laura Vitale on this episode
of Laura in the kitchen I'm going to
show you my recipe for what I call
tiramisu cupcakes
this is basically well pretty much the
most genius idea I've ever had is to
turn one of my favorite all-time plastic
dessert Italian dessert
tiramisu into a cupcake into like a
portable version of one my favorites so
before we get started let's go over the
ingredients you'll need some all-purpose
flour
unsweetened cocoa baking soda salt warm
water eggs regular sugar vegetable oil
instant espresso powder milk vanilla
extract and then in a little bit I will
show you how I like to top them so the
cupcake itself it's not a chocolate
cupcake it's not a coffee cupcake it's
like a mocha because as we all know
tiramisu is a coffee a lovely custard
and then it's got cocoa on top so first
thing you want to do is get your oven
preheated to 350 second thing you wanna
do is take your muffin tin and just line
it with little liners or nothing sticks
and let's just get right into it now I'm
making this in my standing mixer but you
can do this in a bowl with just a whisk
and a spatula and you've got the same
thing you don't need it now all I'm
doing is mixing together all of my dry
ingredients in this little bowl just
that I don't get like a big lump of
cocoa on one in one cupcake and a big
lump of baking soda in another so just
take your time to lightly mix everything
together that's good enough for me
now set that aside and I've got here
some warm water it's not hot but it's I
would say a 120 degrees and to that I'm
going to add in my instant and spresso
and you want to make sure you use
instant special powder for this you
don't want to use regular espresso
because it would not dissolve so let
that just sit aside for a couple minutes
and meanwhile we're going to pretty much
put everything else in here big eggs
sugar
vegetable oil and I'm gonna Singh
vegetable oil but you could use some
melted butter just make sure it's
unsalted your milk and your vanilla just
a touch you don't really need a whole
lot all I'm going to do is mix this
until everything is pretty much well
incorporated it'll take about a minute
or so I'm just going to add in my
espresso and water mixture and just let
that get incorporated really quickly now
I'm just going to turn this off and add
in my dry ingredients
mixer whenever you add any dry
ingredients no fun so now turn this back
on and just mix it enough until the dry
ingredients are incorporated but do not
over mix otherwise you'll end up with
bread instead of fluffy cupcakes that
looks good I'll just take your spatula
give it a good mix now it is a bit more
on the liquid side for a cupcake batter
but trust me when I tell you I've tested
this recipe over and over again and if
you want to put any more flour than this
there would be too dense I want them to
be super super light so you know what
I'm going to use a little handy dandy
ice cream scoop just to get every single
cupcake to be the same size and now just
patiently divide the batter now that
these are all filled are going to go
into your preheated oven 350 between 18
to 20 minutes or until you take a
toothpick insert it into the center if
it comes out clean with no wet batter on
it you know it's done and then you're
going to let them cool completely and
stick around because I'm going to show
you exactly how I love to serve it my
cupcakes baked for about 18 minutes and
I've let them cool completely and for
now I'm just going to serve four so I
can show you how I like to serve it what
you're going to do I'm going to make
like a whipped cream topping for it
because when you're eating traditional
tiramisu it's got that fabulous custard
but you're going to get the same
fabulous like like that custard like
that you will get on a journey soup but
with the whipped cream topping it's
delicious trust me so in this bowl I'm
putting in some heavy whipping cream and
I'm just going to be into a soft peaks
it looks great nice soft peaks now I'm
going to add in some confectioner sugar
and I always like to add confectioner
sugar when I whip when I make whipped
topping or with cream because if this
dissolves better regular sugar ends up
being too grainy but now I'm just going
to whip this until it's nice and stiff
peaks that is perfect so all I like to
do is just super simple top it with some
fresh whipped cream mmm
and then because what traditional
trimming so you sprinkle it with cocoa
powder at the end I wanted to do the
same thing for this but I wanted to give
it some texture because you have soft
sponge from the cupcake you have the
creamy filling which is not actually a
filling is a topping with the whipped
cream I'm going to use mini chocolate
chips instead just to give you a little
bit of texture and of course little
extra chocolate never hurt anybody
am i right on my right okay before I
finish the rest of them I just want to
get run into one so I can show you what
it looks like see that very excited I'm
really scared that it's going to go all
over my nose mmm
that is so awesome that is really
awesome you get that flavor profile from
the traditional classic and trying to
serve but in cupcake form what's up
there simple easy completely completely
adorable everybody's going to love them
I hope you've enjoyed spending time with
me
go to Debbie Debbie Debbie Laura in the
kitchen come to get the recipe yes
bye-bye
